awd_titl_txt: CEDAR:  3D Modeling of Gravity Waves and Airglow
awd_abstract_narration: A 3D model capable of efficiently simulating nonlinear gravity             wave dynamics has been developed and has shown that the dynamics of             wave breaking in the upper mesosphere and lower thermosphere, or                mesopause region, is inherently three-dimensional in nature.  The               PIs propose to modify this model to more accurately simulate                    conditions in the mesopause region, and then couple the dynamical               model to a chemical airglow model for the purpose of studying the               effects of nonlinear gravity wave motions on mesopause region                   airglow.  The coupled gravity wave and airglow model will have the              ability to treat the case of time-dependent chemistry and will be               able to simulate the effects of gravity waves on several different              mesopause region emissions.  The model can then be used to                      strengthen the role of airglow observations in understanding the                dynamics of the mesopause region.  A comparison will be made                    between the model results and the results of observations and                   linear theories.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
